intro: Sida piauhyensis, commonly known as the Piauhy sida, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Sida piauhyensis is known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
